Central Military Hospital 108 and Military Hospital
175 became the 25th medical facility to
perform kidney transplant techniques from
living donors and from brain-dead donors.
Recently, two more cases of end-stage kidney failure were added.
Finally, two patients had successful kidney transplants and were
discharged home to celebrate
Tet. In the joy of the family and the
hospital's medical team,
these are the 9th and 10th successful organ transplants
at District 175 hospital in the
first half.  Last year, two patients, both very young,
born in 1994 and 2004, had their kidneys transplanted from a
living person who was a relative of a patient on
dialysis. They were also
often tired, and their blood pressure was
not very good.  After the
transplant, I felt that my body was healthier.
Whatever I ate, it was delicious. I heard that I was discharged from the
hospital before Tet. I was very happy to be able to celebrate
Tet with my family in two shifts. This time,
there were also all the difficult factors in
terms of health.  In addition, the right kidney is removed, but the
kidney is short and needs to be
reconstructed at the time of surgery, which is
relatively quick. Hopefully in the
near future, it won't be the kidney anymore.
We are developing many transplants.
many other organs and soon apply the
technology to take care of the
health of the people of Ho Chi Minh City. The
area and the south of Ho Chi Minh City
currently have thousands of kidney failure patients who cannot receive
organ transplants.  growing day by day,
but Tibetan resources are scarce,
so each successful organ transplant is a
great blessing for the medical industry.
